title: Ministry of Sports (Brazil)
text:
The Ministry of Sports () was a <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Brazil">cabinet</a>-level <a href="federal%20government%20of%20Brazil">federal</a> <a href="list%20of%20federal%20institutions%20of%20Brazil">ministry</a> in <a href="Federative%20Republic%20of%20Brazil">Brazil</a>. It was established in 1995 as the "Special Ministry of Sports"; in 1998, this became the "Ministry of Sports and Tourism". In 2003, the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Tourism%20%28Brazil%29">Ministry of Tourism</a> was separated from its portfolio. The current Minister of Sports is <a href="George%20Hilton%20%28politician%29">George Hilton</a>, who replaced <a href="Aldo%20Rebelo">Aldo Rebelo</a> in January 2015. On March 30, 2015, George Hilton resigned from his position. <a href="Leonardo%20Picciani">Leonardo Picciani</a> then had taken over as interim Minister.
The Ministry directed the <a href="National%20Institute%20of%20Sport%20Development">National Institute of Sport Development</a> (INDD).
